answers.answer: HiThanks for the post! How are you now?Sensitivity to light is seen in eye infections like conjunctivitis, keratitis and iritis, corneal abrasion, retinal detachment, contact lens irritations, and drugs like tetracycline and doxycycline. Extreme tiredness is also a feature of both low sugar and diabetes, anemia and also of hypothyroidism. You need to get these tested.Please check with your doctor for a lingering infection.This needs a more detailed investigation. I think you should discuss these possibilities with your doctor. It is difficult to comment beyond this without examining and various tests. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: It may have been related or not, but about 30 days ago I had lasik.  Although I have the symptoms of dry eye, for the first week with their antibiotic drops and steriods, I felt fine - saw halos and a lot of sensitivity to the sun.  The day after stopping the drops (1 week) I had a severe head cold, chills, headaches, congestion and no fever.  I had mono as a kid and it I was constantly tired.  I have see the lasik doc 3 times and he gave me a prescription for a few drops a day of steriods.  I would get nausea after them, so I am down to one drop is any and using eye lubricants over the counter.I still have chills, always tired, my eyes see ok but still see halos, at night I tend to feel shaky.  My daughter said I had low sugar so I ate sugar and did feel better, but it comes and goes once or twice a day.  The exhaustion is killing me.  I am not exercising because of being tired.  My schedule is reasonably stressed, so I sleep whenver I can.  I don't think I am depressed, but this is getting me worried.
title: I want to know what is wrong with me
